title: 2020 Tajikistan Cup
text:
The 2020 Tajikistan Cup is the 29th edition of the <a href="Tajikistan%20Cup">Tajikistan Cup</a>, the knockout <a href="association%20football">football</a> tournament of <a href="Tajikistan">Tajikistan</a>, with the winner of the cup qualifying for the <a href="2021%20AFC%20Cup">2021 AFC Cup</a>.
Format.
On 13 June the Preliminary Round draw was held, and the format for the competition confirmed. Due to the <a href="COVID-19%20pandemic%20in%20Tajikistan">COVID-19 pandemic in Tajikistan</a> each stage of the tournament would be a single legged tie instead of a two-legged ties to a single legged tie. On 4 July, the dates and kickoff times for the Preliminary Round matches where confirmed for the 7 and 8 July 2020.
The draw for the Last 16 took place on 15 July 2020, with the eight games to take place over the weekend of 1-3 August 2020.
On 3 August, following <a href="FC%20Istiklol">Istiklol</a>'s victory over <a href="FC%20Mohir">Mohir</a> in the last of the <a href="%23Last%2016">Last 16</a> matches, the Quarter-final draw took place.
Following the conclusion of <a href="FC%20Lokomotiv-Pamir">Lokomotiv-Pamir</a> defeat to <a href="Regar-TadAZ%20Tursunzoda">Regar-TadAZ</a> on 15 September in the <a href="%23Quarterfinals">Quarterfinals</a>, the Semifinal draw took place.
After <a href="FC%20Khatlon">Khatlon</a>'s victory over <a href="FK%20Istaravshan">Istaravshan</a> on 23 September, to join <a href="Ravshan%20Kulob">Ravshan Kulob</a> in the Final of the Tajikistan Cup, it was announced that the game would take place on 10 October at the <a href="Pamir%20Stadium">Pamir Stadium</a> in <a href="Dushanbe">Dushanbe</a>.
